### Test: quanteda::textmodel-ca 

To test the performance of calculation applying on dense dfm matrix versus on sparse dfm matrix.

For a relatively larger dataset, ramdomized svd achieves a substantial speedup

```{r}
require(quanteda, quietly = TRUE, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
ie2010dfm <- dfm(data_corpus_irishbudget2010, verbose = FALSE)

ie2010dfm_dense <- as.matrix(ie2010dfm)

microbenchmark::microbenchmark(
    ca = ca::ca(ie2010dfm_dense), 
    ca_rsvd = textmodel_ca_sparse(ie2010dfm),
    ca_RSpectra = textmodel_ca_sparse(ie2010dfm, method = "RSpectra"),
    times=10, unit = 'relative')
```

```{r}
data(SOTUCorpus, package = "quantedaData")
SOTUdfm <- dfm(SOTUCorpus)
SOTUdfm_dense <- as.matrix(SOTUdfm)
microbenchmark::microbenchmark(
    ca = ca::ca(SOTUdfm_dense), 
    ca_rsvd = textmodel_ca_sparse(SOTUdfm),
    ca_RSpectra = textmodel_ca_sparse(SOTUdfm, method = "RSpectra"),
    times=10, unit = 'relative')
```
